he is unable to write we don't know if that is part of the injury or if he was never able to write
he should be ready for spring training

we talked to the doctor again today our worries aren't that great i think what happened with scotty is if you know him at all he's not a go-easy guy i think when he's working on something it's an excess of swings excess of batting practice we just have to get him to back off a little bit and give his shoulder a chance to rest a little bit i talked to the doctor who performed his surgery again today and medically nobody has any concerns about him long-term continuing to play he just needs a couple of days here and there in the course of the middle of the summer but we're not worried at all like i've said before we made the trade we did all the background check we had to do on the surgery and we checked with all the rehab people we had our doctors check his shoulder is as strong as it can possibly be it just gets a little fatigued from overwork
he had a good camp last year but he weighed 181 pounds and was a little bit high in body fat
michael has not played a game for us yet this summer because he had a slight calf problem
i had noticed yesterday that when we were taking batting practice he didn't make any throws or anything and sure enough his elbow is a little tender

he's going to have an mri today to just check everything out and make sure if there is something we have missed according to head athletic trainer steve antonopulos it's not the knee it's beneath the knee the bursa sac is causing him a little irritation right now he doesn't think it's anything serious but to prevent anything we are going to check it with an mri and hope it'll be fine and just a little bit sore
i'm confident that the injury is gone but if he does say he feels something you have to be extremely cautious
we're going to get him checked out with an mri just to make sure there's nothing going on in there that we don't know about
no no a hamstring is a hamstring and that could linger on the ankle he'll be fine nothing bad
jason capizzi has a foot injury

i know you didn't well we've got him resting now apparently some kritters drugged him and somehow managed to haul him into our high-security storage room i've never seen him so week so i have no idea what they might have drugged him up with i mean he can lift a ton of weight but he couldn't force his way out of that room must be something that deteriorated his muscle performance
he's very sharp mentally i don't know how many training camps he's been through but he'll be ok and in the time being it will give us a chance to look at our youngster
